FuncDef:
The delay-suppression enable command enables alarm suppression on the Router.
The undo delay-suppression enable command disables alarm suppression on the Router. The delay-suppression enable command enables alarm suppression on the Router. The undo delay-suppression enable command disables alarm suppression on the Router. By default, alarm suppression is enabled.
ExtraInfo:
You can configure a suppression period for reporting an alarm or clearing an alarm. An alarm is reported if the relevant fault persists after the suppression period expires; a clear alarm is reported if the relevant fault is rectified during the suppression period.
Alarm suppression is used to suppress the managed nodes that generate repeated alarms, service intermittence alarms, and persistent alarms so as to prevent a large number of invalid alarms.
